description: Squarefree part of n!: n! divided by its largest square divisor.
comments: Smallest number such that n!*a(n) is a square.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3386 (next term has 1001 digits)
formula: a(n) = A007913(n!) = n!/A055071(n) = A000142(n)/A055071(n).log a(n) ~ n log 2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 03 2012sqrt(n!) = A055772(n) * sqrt(a(n)). - _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 16 2015
mathematica: Table[#/Last@ Select[Divisors@ #, IntegerQ@ Sqrt@ # &] &[n!], {n, 26}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 02 2016 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 19 2000
